work.name: Mim solutions
highlights: Contributed to a project aimed at matching tweets with corresponding articles, which culminated in a paper submission. My responsibilities included implementing a LDA baseline model and developing a PyTorch implementation for the primary model. The architecture of our model was similar to Open AI's CLIP architecture
Contributed to work flow of other teams by helping with incorporation of tools such as: Hydra, pytorch ligtning, docker and ruff
Helped with conceptual work when working on theoretical foundations of projects

work.name: Iterators
highlights: Assisted in the regular maintenance of the mobile application called Obi, by diagnosing and resolving software bugs to ensure optimal functionality and user experience.
Utilized a robust stack that included Scala, internal libraries, Akka, and Cats.

courses: Foudations of mathematics, Linear algebra I/II, Mathematical analysis I/II/III/IV, Topology, Abstract Algebra, Differential equations, Probability theory I/II, Functional analysis, Statistics, Deep learning, Natural league processing, Reinforcement learning, Statistical Analysis, Numerical Analysis
Introduction to programming (conducted in C), Discrete mathematics, Concurrent programming, Algorithms and Data structures, Databases, Object oriented programming, C++/Rust course, Operating systems
